title.narrative: Climate Adaptation and Disaster Risk Reduction

description.narrative: The Climate Adaptation and Disaster Risk Reduction and Education (CADRE) program aims to build the resilience of vulnerable communities in the Federated States of Micronesia (FSM) and the Republic of the Marshall Islands (RMI) to natural hazards, including those that are climate change induced. The program will educate school children and communities about climate change and disaster risks, helping them determine appropriate responses and implement priority activities in their local communities in a coordinated manner that supports higher level national plans and strategies. It is expected that 10,000 school-aged children in up to 50 schools and surrounding communities will benefit from CADRE. The program is also supporting the RMI with the provision of 225 household water tanks for the outer island of Ebeye. In 2010-11, AusAID provided and installed 200 household water tanks on Ebeye, the provision of another 225 water tanks will supply the remaining households in Ebeye with a water t
